subject: Re: getting TestRunner to see junit.samples.AllTests
msgSnippet: Thanks. Yes and No,  it wasn t that simple - I d tried it without - but the answer is pretty darn simple. The final result that worked is

Thanks. Yes and No,  it wasn't that simple - I'd tried it without -
but the=
 answer is pretty darn simple.

The final result that worked is
JUNIT_HOME=
=3DC:\J2SDK_Forte
CLASSPATH=3D.;%JUNIT_HOME%\jnit3.7\junit.jar;%JUNIT_HOME\=
junit3.7;

which is equivalent to
CLASSPATH=3D.;C:\J2SDK_Forte\jnit3.7\juni=
t.jar;C:\J2SDK_Forte\junit3.7;

which I'd tried before but it didn't work -=
 I thought.

What I discovered is that I had to drop out of the DOS window =
after
each change of the environment. I'd make a change in the environment
=
to CLASSPATH but stay in the DOS same DOS window so it never saw the
change=
.

Thanks for thinking about this. Clif






--- In junit@y..., Mats Nyber=
g <mn@t...> wrote:
> i have the same set up but for the trailing slash on t=
he end of 
> %JUNIT_home% that works
